poem:
A New Chorus

The chorus lifts,  
unseen murmurs  
in ripened fields,  
abstract verbs rustle—  
change, shape, mend.  
Across the land,  
names echo  
where banners  
once whispered—  
now they stand  
tall as trees,  
roots entwined  
beneath old stones,  
seeds of future voices,  
whispering, rising—  
a scattered dream,  
in tomorrow's soil.
